description: Alteration, part conversion and extension (including two additional floors to the existing building, five-storey rear and ground floor extensions) to provide a total of 149 residential units (3 x studio and 146 x 2 bed units); provision of public library/adult learning and activity centre at ground floor level together with a business development centre/community group office and meeting space at first and second floor level in the new rear extension; 117 car parking spaces, cycle parking, vehicular access from The Green and Southbridge Way and other associated works
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). |  Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.4 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Prior to any development a survey of all trees and shrubs within the site, to BS5837:2005 identifying those to be retained and how they are to be protected during construction works, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be carried out before any works commence and retained during the course of the development.   REASON:  In order to protect trees of value in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. |  Full details of both hard and soft landscaping, including tree planting and a phased programme of works, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any development of the site. Such details shall include replacement tree planting along the site frontage to The Green to compensate for existing trees that would be lost. The landscaping works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. |  No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment and fences to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained.   REASON: To protect the appearance of the site and security of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Full details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development, and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of the relevant residential units and the other accommodation in the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with  policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG7 'Accessible Ealing'. |  Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of refuse storage and waste management (including provision for recycling) for the residential and the other uses, in accordance with adopted standards, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of any part of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the development and to meet the Council's sustainability policies, in accordance with policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Notwithstanding the layout of the car parking spaces shown on the submitted drawings, details of the vehicle and pedestrian accesses and car parking layout shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works. Such details as approved shall be marked out on the site, prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall thereafter be kept continuously available without obstruction for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  and safe access within the site in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Notwithstanding the information provided in the submitted application and on the submitted drawings, details shall be provided of the access and manoeuvring arrangements for refuse collection vehicles. Such details as approved shall be provided on site prior to first occupation of the development, and thereafter the areas reserved                                    as access and manoeuvring areas for refuse collection vehicles shall be kept clear at all times and not used for any other purpose without the prior permission in writing of the Local planning authority.	  REASON: To ensure that adequate access and manoeuvring space for refuse collection vehicles is available within the site in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  The cycle parking spaces shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, and thereafter shall be permanently retained and kept continuously available for cycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.   REASON: To ensure that adequate cycle parking is available within the site in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  The development will be affected by mixed transport and commercial/industrial noise at a level which falls into Category C noise exposure and also building services noise.  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for Developers".  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. |  Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any development is commenced, to demonstrate that the sound reduction index of  separating party floors/ceilings and walls, Rw, will achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided:q	The background L90,15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured inside a habitable room of the nearest affected premises with windows closed, shall not be increased when any amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated at the same position, using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.Such details shall demonstrate that the insulation between the commercial parts of the building and the dwellings are sufficient to prevent noise disturbance.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. |  Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any development is commenced, to demonstrate that the composite sound reduction index of the building envelope, Rw, will achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided: The background L90,15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured at 1 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected premises, shall not be increased when the amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated in the same position, using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. |  Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for a suitable mechanical ventilation system, to ensure doors and windows are kept closed during hot weather and externally sited ventilation plant associated with this system will be silenced to a standard not exceeding LFNR 35 Leq,5min (octaves), or LFNR 30 Leq,5min (one third octaves) measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises. The approved scheme shall be implemented prior to first occupation of each part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 2.6 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality'. |  Details of a ventilation scheme for the library shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development. Such details shall indicate that ventilation intakes for the ground floor library shall be located at the rear of the building. The approved details shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect staff and users of the library and to ensure a satisfactory standard of air quality, in accordance with policy 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality'. |   Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for a suitable sound limiting device to control the output from any amplification system to a maximum noise level agreed with the Authority.  The limiter device shall also be connected to external doors, so that the power to the amplifiers will be cut if a door is opened, other than for means of escape from fire.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development and of the wider area, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. |  Use of the library, adult learning and activity centre and the business development centre, shall not extend beyond 2300 hours.  REASON:  To prevent noise nuisance to the occupiers of the residential units and occupiers of the wider area, including noise from people leaving the site late at night, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. |  Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating that the recommendations of the Institute of Lighting Engineers made in its Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution will be met, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of any part of the building and maintained in accordance with the approved standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with  policies 4.1 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of any contamination, and for the remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence.    REASON:  To protect the health and safety of occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Details of crime prevention and security measures for the building, car parking areas,  cycle parking areas (including access controls to the car park and entrance doors), and bin storage areas, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of any part of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON:  In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 8 'Safer Ealing'. |  Notwithstanding the information provided with the application, details of measures to provide 10 per cent of the energy requirements of the development as renewable energy shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the building and retained permanently.  REASON:  To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with policy 2.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  Notwithstanding the information provided on the submitted drawings, details of the elevational designs and materials of the library and resource centre shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development. The details so approved shall be implemented and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure that a satisfactory external design is achieved at ground floor level, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). |  All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON:  To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'.
